item.title: I Migrated 40 Projects to Central Package Management in Minutes
item.description:
Get the source code here: https://www.patreon.com/milanjovanovic Want to master Clean Architecture? Go here: https://bit.ly/3PupkOJ Want to unlock Modular Monoliths? Go here: https://bit.ly/3SXlzSt
Keeping NuGet package versions in sync across a large .NET solution can be a nightmare. Central Package Management fixes that ‚Äî and in this video, I‚Äôll show you how I migrated 40 projects in just minutes.
You‚Äôll learn:
- What Central Package Management is and why it matters. - How to set it up with Directory.Packages.props. - Using the Central Package Converter CLI to migrate an existing solution. - Tips to reduce merge conflicts and keep dependencies consistent. - If you‚Äôre tired of version drift and juggling multiple .csproj edits, this is a must-watch.
üìå Resources: Central Package Management in .NET - Simplify NuGet Dependencies ‚Üí https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog/central-package-management-in-net-simplify-nuget-dependencies Central Package Management Docs ‚Üí https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/Central-Package-Management CentralisedPackageConverter Tool ‚Üí https://github.com/Webreaper/CentralisedPackageConverter
üß† Full source code available to my Patreon supporters: https://www.patreon.com/milanjovanovic
Check out my courses: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/courses
Read my Blog here: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech/blog
Join my weekly .NET newsletter: https://www.milanjovanovic.tech
Chapters 0:00 What is Central Package Management? 1:36 Manually moving to Central Package Management 4:15 CLI tool for moving to Central Package Management 6:58 Managing Nuget packages from VS

item.title: LLMs aren‚Äôt world models
item.description: I believe that language models aren‚Äôt world models. It‚Äôs a weak claim ‚Äî I‚Äôm not saying they‚Äôre useless, or that we‚Äôre done milking them. It‚Äôs also a fuzzy-sounding claim ‚Äî with its trillion weights, who can prove that there‚Äôs something an LLM isn't a model of? But I hope to make my claim clear and persuasive enough with some examples.

item.title: AC vc DC: who would win a modern Battle of the Currents?
item.description: Recently, I was asked: what if Edison had won the Battle of the Currents? As power grids today are increasingly dominated by inverter-based generation, could a direct current (dc) grid be more effective than the alternating current (ac) grids we rely on today? Would we still need spinning mass, inertia, and frequency control

item.title: Wikimedia Foundation Challenges UK Online Safety Act Regulations ‚Äì Wikimedia Foundation
item.description: UPDATE: On Monday, 11 August, the High Court of Justice dismissed the Wikimedia Foundation‚Äôs challenge to the UK‚Äôs Online Safety Act (OSA) Categorisation Regulations. While the decision does not provide the immediate legal protections for Wikipedia that we hoped for, the Court‚Äôs ruling emphasized the responsibility of Ofcom and the UK government to ensure Wikipedia‚Ä¶.
